items.question: What are people saying about parks near Half Moon Bay, CA?
items.answer:
This is a review for parks near Half Moon Bay, CA:
"We parked in a nice lot accross the highway from the beach and found very serviceable stairs to the far right of the trails that took us all the way down to the beach. The stairs looked new so folks that were taking the "hard way" down may not be aware and there is no sign letting you know they are there. Beautiful beach, not crowded, spectacular surf and the thrill of rip tides! A perfect sun yourself while having a picnic spot. If you are in the area take the time to visit, it is well worth the miminmal effort (and porta-potties exist, which seem seldom used)."

items.answer:

"There is no ocean view from here at all, despite the name. Still, this is a wonderful park for kids. There are couple play structures, grass area, restrooms, a large barbecue, and several picnic tables. We stopped by here to have a quick picnic lunch and ended up staying for couple hours because the kids wanted to run around and climb the play structures for a long time. There is not much shade, so do bring sunscreen. Also, try to sit far away from the barbecue grill because you will not want to socially distance from the food others are grilling..."

results.title: Top 10 Picnic Spots On The Gold Coast | Destination Gold Coast
results.description: What better way to spend a sunny day than to pack a picnic and head to one of Gold Coast's gorgeous locations to enjoy the simple things?
extra_snippets: You’ll be spoilt for choice with shady spots, playgrounds, picnic tables, toilets and BBQs, not to mention dreamy beach scenes a stone’s throw away. But we’ve put together a list of some other places to explore – some firm faves and a few lesser known spots that are off the beaten track. Stock up on premium produce, roll up the rug and get ready for a delightful day spent at one of Gold Coast’s top picnic spots.

This beautiful hill-top spot has views for days – from up here you can see where the best surf is, spot whales out to sea and enjoy an elevated picnic perched up high above Coolangatta. RT Peak Memorial Park has recently undergone a major makeover with a new lookout platform, seating, picnic settings, BBQs, a large shelter to protect you from the elements and a hot tap to make a cuppa (BYO teabags!). You can either drive or walk up, but be warned, it’s quite steep so make sure you’ve got helping hands to carry all your picnic gear.

This is really just scratching the surface when it comes to top Gold Coast picnic spots. We haven’t even got started on the Hinterland which is full of hidden gems and lush locations boasting incredible views across rolling valleys down to the coast. Check out this blog for five more fabulous locations to roll out your rug and enjoy a delicious meal al fresco.

Stock up on premium produce, roll up the rug and get ready for a delightful day spent at one of Gold Coast’s top picnic spots. This beautiful hill-top spot has views for days – from up here you can see where the best surf is, spot whales out to sea and enjoy an elevated picnic perched up high above Coolangatta.

It links Poplar Beach to Half Moon Bay State Beach along the top of a bluff, offering scenic views of the Pacific Ocean and the Mavericks ...

extra_snippets: Poplar Beach, as the name suggests, is the most popular. Other than picnic and sun-bathing at Poplar Beach, you can also go for a hike on the Coastal Trail. It links Poplar Beach to Half Moon Bay State Beach along the top of a bluff, offering scenic views of the Pacific Ocean and the Mavericks surfing location.

Located only about 45 minutes from San Francisco is the beautiful coastal town of Half Moon Bay. Known for beaches including Half Moon Bay State Beach and Poplar Beach, these areas are easily accessible from San Francisco and are perfect for picnics, hikes and nature walks.

Alamo Square Park has quite a few picnic tables where you can set up and even though they don’t provide grills, you can bring your own charcoal grill. There are also plenty of bathrooms. ... Located only about 45 minutes from San Francisco is the beautiful coastal town of Half Moon Bay.

We’ve rounded up the best picnic areas in San Francisco so you can enjoy the cities greatest assets on an alfresco dining adventure. ... Crissy Field, a former military airfield, now attracts a significant number of locals and tourists. Part of the Presidio, Golden Gate National Recreation Area, it has everything you need for a great day outdoors including many beautiful spots for a picnic.

results.title: Throw Down A Rug At 12 Of The Best Picnic Spots On The Sunshine Coast | URBAN LIST SUNSHINE COAST
results.description: From our picturesque coastline to the lush hinterland, here are 12 of the best picnic spots on the Sunshine Coast—some secret and some local favourites.
extra_snippets: If the crowds at Mooloolaba are a bit much for you, dig out that bottle of champers you’ve been saving for a special occasion, grab a kilo of prawns and a lemon from the fish markets, plus some snuggly blankets and head down to Point Cartwright with your bae to watch the moon rise. One of the best picnic spots on the Sunshine Coast, Cotton Tree Park is waterfront and spacious.

Here are 12 of the best picnic spots on the Sunshine Coast—some secret and some local favourites—to get you dining again in the great outdoors. So pack your hamper, load up the car (you can drive up to 50km from home) and explore somewhere new.

If you like your Sunshine Coast picnic spots with a bit of cultural heritage, head to this park and playground, inspired by local traditional owners, the Kabi Kabi people. There’s plenty of space to spread out your picnic, but the whole park is an off-leash dog area, so make sure you keep your BBQ chook safe from drooling Labradors.

We love a lazy picnic spot—one where you can literally park the car, walk a few metres and be on a deserted island. Okay, it’s not quite deserted, but it is an island that you can get to by foot (or by swimming if you want to impress someone). It’s perfect for throwing in a line, dangling your toes in the water and chilling in the sun.

results.title: 10 Best Picnic Spots in the Bay Area
results.description: Choose your next family adventure for sunny days out with the ultimate guide to the 10 best picnic spots in the Bay Area.

meta_url.path: › home  › travel  › 10 best picnic spots in the bay area

extra_snippets: In the Bay Area, my family usually picnics in the middle of a hike at a nice viewpoint on top of a hill or along a water stream. For my girls, it’s a welcome break where they can put down their backpack, kick back their shoes, roam free and explore the surroundings on their own. Picnics are also a great way to get together with friends and let the kids play games while the adults tend to the BBQ or chat the day away. Whatever your favorite picnic option is, here are the 10 best picnic spots in the Bay Area, to relax al fresco and bless our California weather.

Shoreline Park and Lake offer a lot of fun options for families besides picnic tables on grassy lawns. ... From the boat-themed playground to the pedal boats or the beach, Shoreline is water-fun-central but bring the bikes in case the kids want to ride along the San Francisco Bay. Tons of flat trails to be enjoyed! Have fun picknicking! Note: This piece was first published on Well Kiddos on May 15, 2012. Well Kiddos™, a Half Moon Bay organization led by Manuela Hipkins, advocates providing children with healthy food choices when dining in or out.

Close to the Point Reyes Lighthouse (shuttle bus option), Drakes Bay is a favorite picnic spot in Marin as kids can play in waves, build sand castles or run around. It can get chilly, so bring a few layers, and it’s definitely a lovely spot to unwind (no cell phone reception) and stop by the beach cafe & bookstore to stock on nature guides before heading out for some whale-watching from the cliffs.

Angel Island deserves a medal for offering the only ferry-accessible picnic spots in the entire Bay Area. Start the day with a short ferry ride and once on the island, decide on your best picnic option. Most families simply claim a table at Ayala Cove by the ferry landing where a large lawn area offers great views on the bay.

results.title: Top Picnic Spots on the North Shore - Northshore Magazine
results.description: Find out the prettiest picnic spots north of Boston, plus where to pick up all your dinner fixings.
extra_snippets: When gardens are in full bloom and woodland and water views are at their best, it’s the perfect time to pack up a picnic and head out to celebrate the season’s bounty of beauty. Here are a few of our favorite spots.

Spread out in the gazebo, on picnic benches, or at Half Moon Beach, a tiny, beautiful cove. Castle Hill: The Allee, behind the Great House, is picnic perfect, as are the Casino or garden areas. Appleton Farms: There are stroller-friendly paths, shady spots, and quintessential New England views.
Stage Fort Park: Picnic at this oceanfront park overlooking the harbor and lawn. Spread out in the gazebo, on picnic benches, or at Half Moon Beach, a tiny, beautiful cove.

Maudslay State Park: Gardens, meadows, and towering pines make for lush picnic spots. Curzon Mill Road. Atkinson Common: Twenty-one acres of gardens, historic structures, and notable monuments create picnic hideaways. High Street.

Detailed information, along with GPS coordinates for Crescent Moon Picnic Area in Arizona, United States by Gannon McGhee (Landscape Photography)

Follow the road right for Red Rock Crossing Road and turn left into the Crescent Moon Picnic Area. Entrance to the park is $10 per vehicle. Sedona, Arizona, has a past as colorful as its world-famous red rocks. At one time it billed itself as “Arizona’s Little Hollywood” due to the dozens of B westerns and other Hollywood classics filmed there. My wife and I have visited Sedona several times, and while I always enjoy photographing the scenic landscape, one of my favorite subjects is Cathedral Rock. Crescent Moon Picnic Area is a great place to photograph Cathedral Rock.

Crescent Moon Picnic Area is a great place to photograph Cathedral Rock. There is a path along Oak Creek or you can hike up the hill to the north. The trail to the top of the hill starts just north of the entrance to the park off of Red Rock Crossing Road. For best lighting, visit early in the morning or late in the afternoon.

results.title: The Top Five Features To Find On The Full Moon
results.description: Monday's Supermoon is the biggest and closest in 68 years. But every full Moon holds a feast for the naked eye, if you know what you're looking at!
extra_snippets: 4.) Copernicus crater. Visible as the bright spot amidst the dark maria, Copernicus, at 107 km in diameter, offers the greatest visual contrast of any lunar crater to human eyes. The largest of the lunar maria, Oceanus Procellarum comprises more than 10% of the Moon's surface....

Jul 17, 2018,10:00am EDTWhat Is (And Isn't) Scientific About The Multiverse ... Opinions expressed by Forbes Contributors are their own. ... This article is more than 7 years old. ... The full Moon of October 22, 2010, as taken from Madison, Alabama. Image credit: Gregory H. Revera,... [+] under a c.c.a.-s.a.-3.0 license.

The largest of the lunar maria, Oceanus Procellarum comprises more than 10% of the Moon's surface.... [+] Image credit: © 2010 Lehigh University / Carol Kiely, from the Moon Dust project. 5.) Oceanus Procellarum. The largest of all the lunar maria, it's the only one designated an ocean. It covers approximately 4 million km2 and contained Apollo 12's landing site. The annotated prominent features -- many of which are naked-eye features -- of the near side of the... [+] Moon.

Tycho crater itself is hard to discern during the Moon's full phase, but the bright white spot where... [+] rays lead to are clearly visible. Image credit: Joe Huber, 2004, via Wikimedia Commons user Svdmolen under c.c.a.-s.a.-3.0. 3.) Tycho crater. A highly-reflective impact crater over 100 km in diameter in the southern lunar highlands. Prominent rays emanate from the impact site. Samples collected by Apollo 16 determined Tycho's young age: 108 million years. The full Moon, as imaged in 1992 by NASA's Galileo spacecraft.

results.title: Los Angeles picnic spots: 20 of the best places to lay out a blanket - Curbed LA
results.description: From beachfront parks in Santa Monica to hillside spots in Griffith Park with city views, these are the best places to lay down a blanket and dig into a picnic spread.
extra_snippets: Los Angeles’s parks, beaches, and other open-air venues offer an array of ideal spots for eating al fresco. This map tracks 20 of the most scenic and pleasant spaces for picnicking. (Those looking for great shops to load up a picnic basket might find some help here.)

Valley dwellers don't have to drive over the hill to have a lakeside picnic or cruise around that lake in a pedal boat that looks like a swan. Pets are ok here (provided they’re on a leash) and there are picnic tables, as well as lots of spots for a more traditional-style, on-the-grass picnic.

Picnic benches and grills and old animal cages to explore: everything needed for a memorable outdoor eating experience. This corner of Griffith Park could be a pre-hike or post-hike snack spot, or simply a good place to lounge. Good driving and zoo-locating directions can be found here.

A great spot to picnic that allows your dog to have a good time too. This unofficial dog park has a few picnic tables and more spots for just throwing down a blanket. The dogs can roam while the humans nosh—everybody wins.

extra_snippets: The San Mateo County Coastside around Half Moon Bay is one of the largest beach areas in the San Francisco Bay Area. There are also scores of very unique recreation areas throughout the foothills and mountains surrounding the coast from Pescadero through Montara.

The Coastside encompasses the cities of Half Moon Bay, Miramar, Montara, Moss Beach, El Granada, San Gregorio, La Honda, and Pescadero. The Visit Half Moon Bay web site is a cooperative effort of the Half Moon Bay Coastside Chamber of Commerce & Visitors’ Bureau, the Half Moon Bay Hotel Business Improvement District, and the Half Moon Bay Downtown Association.

There are also scores of very unique recreation areas throughout the foothills and mountains surrounding the coast from Pescadero through Montara. Hiking, biking, surfing, kayaking, paddleboarding, tidepooling, strolling the beaches, walking mountain trails are just some of the things to do and activities here in the Bay Area on California State Beaches and in the parks around Half Moon Bay.
Get info in person at the Half Moon Bay Visitor Center – 637 Main Street

results.title: 15 of the Best Picnic Spots around the World - AFAR
results.description: Is there anything more relaxing than a picnic on a beautiful day? Picture this: family, friends, wine, cheese, bread, fruit, salads. Bring your sunglasses and sunscreen because chances are high that you will be lounging for quite a while.
extra_snippets: If you’re looking to escape the chaos and see a hidden gem, Arderne is perfect place for a romantic stroll or afternoon picnic. ... La Isla de Guilligan (Gilligan’s Island, though not the one from the television show) is a popular hangout for Puerto Rican locals. I myself am only home for several weeks a year and I still go once or twice every year. The island is sometimes isolated and sometimes crowded. It boasts snorkeling (I’ve spotted many anemones, fish, crabs, starfish, and barracudas), calm water perfect for floating and swimming, and several trees from which you can jump into the water.

The gardens are a cultural gathering point for some in the community, and the giant fig is known as the wedding tree, where newlyweds have their photo taken. If you’re looking to escape the chaos and see a hidden gem, Arderne is perfect place for a romantic stroll or afternoon picnic.

If you choose to do the latter, you might want to take your kayak to Isla Ballena (see my highlight “Kayaking and Snorkeling and Hoping for Whales”). This tends to be a day trip, so I suggest you have some food. You can either pack up your own or, if you take the ferry, place an order before embarking and tell them when you’d like to have it delivered. There are picnic pavilions that you can claim if it’s a calm day or you get there early.

The park is hugely popular, and so to call it an escape from the bustle of the city is often not accurate, especially on mild summer days and the first warm ones in the spring when thousands of residents head to its playing fields, bike and run along the road that loops the park, and enjoy picnics on the Sheep Meadow or one of its other lawns.

results.title: The 20 Best Honeymoon Destinations for 2024.
results.description: Planning a post-wedding getaway? Look no further than this list. From iconic honeymoon hotspots (Bora Bora) to less conventional locales (Tanzania), you're bound to find the perfect destination for you and your new spouse.
extra_snippets: We rank the 20 Best Honeymoon Destinations for 2024. See which places our readers like the best, and vote for your favorites.

Made up of about 115 islands in the Indian Ocean, this archipelago off the eastern coast of Africa is ideal for sailing, diving and spotting Aldabra giant tortoises. Visit the Vallée de Mai, a nature preserve so beautiful it was once thought to be the original Garden of Eden, and marvel at the park's legendary coco-de-mer trees. If a romantic picnic on the beach is more your speed, head to the tranquil shores of Beau Vallon or Anse Source d'Argent.

Active twosomes can hike along the Napali Coast, explore Waimea Canyon State Park and kayak down the Wailua River. Helicopter tours of Kauai's most scenic spots are also sure to provide newlyweds with lifelong memories. But Kauai offers plenty of opportunity for relaxation, too.

Plus, its beaches are prime spots for kitesurfing, scuba diving and lounging. Couples drawn to exploration can also hike the lush Le Pouce mountain, or spend some time in the culturally diverse capital city of Port Louis. To save some coin, stay at a hotel that offers honeymoon packages.
